{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3421914,"name":"E DiCarlo","username":"E_DiCarlo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ecae2f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T22:36:01.775Z","cooked":"

My team is switching over to swerve drive this year. We are having trouble trying to use the SysID java sample code provided by WPILib. The sample code assumes external relative encoders for drive control, but we are using the encoder internal to the TalonFX within the Kraken motor for drive control. It should be easy to modify the sample code (with some multiplier differences) to use the TalonFX motor.getPosition and motor.getVelocity in place of the WPILib encoder.getDistance and encoder.getRate used in the sample code. However, the way the example code is written, we are not able to do this successfully.

The WPILib sysID code is here
The getDistance and getRate are used in the left and right drive motor log sections.

Does anyone have java code for SysID that uses internal TalonFX encoders, or does anyone know how to properly modify the example SysID to use TalonFX encoders for drive? See below sample code:

.linearPosition(m_distance.mut_replace(m_leftEncoder.getDistance(), Meters))

.linearVelocity(m_velocity.mut_replace(m_leftEncoder.getRate(), MetersPerSecond));

Phoenix 6

Plumbing & Running SysId

For the purpose of this documentation, we focus on the integration of Phoenix 6 and WPILib’s SysId API to characterize common mechanisms. Detailed documentation on the SysId routines can be found h...

Thanks. I saw this CTRE SysID example code, but it is for one motor (flywheel) only.
Can I run this for just one side of the drive at a time (i.e., do left front and left rear, using follower, then run again for the right front and rear)? Or will I need to modify this code to run for both sides at one time, as was done for the sample code I had originally looked at?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T13:13:52.206Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470942,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-java-code-for-sysid-using-ctre-talonfx-encoders-for-drive-control","display_username":"E DiCarlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19820,"username":"ArchdukeTim","name":"Tim Winters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30734,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-java-code-for-sysid-using-ctre-talonfx-encoders-for-drive-control/470942/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422013,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T13:35:30.602Z","cooked":"
E_DiCarlo:

Or will I need to modify this code to run for both sides at one time, as was done for the sample code I had originally looked at?

You will need to do this. In general you have to identify systems under ordinary working loads.

I tried to do the necessary modifications, and am having issues with one thing - the SysIdRoutine.Mechanism within the DriveMechanism subsystem class. I’m not sure how to specify two motors here. See below for code for one motor that was commented out, and code for two motors (leftMotor and rightMotor) was added. However, this gives me an error on the word “volts” in rightMotor.setControl (error says “volts cannot be resolved”). I’m not familiar with Lambda expressions or SysIDRoutines. Any idea what is wrong in the code below?

      new SysIdRoutine.Mechanism(
            (Measure<Voltage> volts)-> //m_motorToTest.setControl(m_sysIdControl.withOutput(volts.in(Volts))),
            m_leftMotor.setControl(m_sysIdControl.withOutput(volts.in(Volts))),
            m_rightMotor.setControl(m_sysIdControl.withOutput(volts.in(Volts))), 
            null,
            this));
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T17:37:08.530Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470942,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-java-code-for-sysid-using-ctre-talonfx-encoders-for-drive-control","display_username":"E DiCarlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30734,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-java-code-for-sysid-using-ctre-talonfx-encoders-for-drive-control/470942/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422153,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T20:00:56.130Z","cooked":"

You specify two motors by passing a function that sends the output to two different motors. If you’re not familiar with lambda expressions, you need to become familiar or you won’t be able to use the tooling. They’re not that hard; spent some time practicing with them in a repl or empty project.
